Questions.Question: What is the name of the first exoplanet discovered outside our solar system?
Questions.Explanation: 51 Pegasi b, discovered in 1995, was the first confirmed exoplanet orbiting a star similar to our Sun.

Questions.Question: Who was the first astronomer to observe the moons of Jupiter?
Questions.Explanation: In 1610, Galileo Galilei became the first person to observe the four largest moons of Jupiter, now known as the Galilean moons.

Questions.Question: What is the most abundant element in the universe?
Questions.Explanation: Hydrogen makes up about 75% of the elemental mass of the universe, followed by helium at around 24%.

Questions.Question: Which telescope discovered the expanding nature of the universe?
Questions.Explanation: The Hubble Space Telescope, in 1929, provided evidence for the expansion of the universe with its observations of distant galaxies.

Questions.Question: What does CMB stand for in astronomy?
Questions.Explanation: The Cosmic Microwave Background is electromagnetic radiation left over from an early stage of the universe, providing vital insights into its evolution.

Questions.Question: The first proof of the existence of black holes was provided by the observation of gravitational waves. True or False?
Questions.Explanation: The Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO) made the groundbreaking discovery in 2015, confirming the existence of black holes.

Questions.Question: Who discovered the first pulsar, a highly magnetized rotating neutron star?
Questions.Explanation: In 1967, Jocelyn Bell Burnell discovered the first pulsar while studying radio waves from distant galaxies.

Questions.Question: Which spacecraft provided the first close-up images of Pluto?
Questions.Explanation: Launched in 2006, New Horizons spacecraft performed the historic flyby of Pluto in 2015, capturing detailed images of the dwarf planet.

Questions.Question: What type of star is the Sun categorized as?
Questions.Explanation: The Sun is a G-type main-sequence star, commonly referred to as a yellow dwarf, and is about 4.6 billion years old.

Questions.Question: In what year was the first evidence of an extrasolar planetary system discovered?
Questions.Explanation: In 1992, astronomers announced the discovery of two planets orbiting the pulsar PSR B1257+12, marking the first confirmed detection of exoplanets.

Questions.Question: What is the most abundant chemical element in Earth's crust?
Questions.Explanation: Oxygen is the most abundant element in the Earth's crust, comprising about 46.6% by weight.

Questions.Question: Which constellation contains the brightest star in the night sky?
Questions.Explanation: Canis Major houses Sirius, the brightest star visible from Earth, and is also known as the 'Greater Dog' constellation.

Questions.Question: Which scientist proposed the concept of an expanding universe?
Questions.Explanation: In 1927, Georges Lemaître proposed the idea of an expanding universe based on his solution to the equations of general relativity.

Questions.Question: Which space mission discovered evidence of water on Mars?
Questions.Explanation: The Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter discovered hydrated salts and recurring slope lineae, suggesting the presence of liquid water on Mars in 2015.

Questions.Question: What is the largest moon of Saturn?
Questions.Explanation: Titan, larger than the planet Mercury, is the only moon in the solar system with a dense atmosphere and liquids on its surface.

Questions.Question: Which astronomer first proposed the heliocentric model of the solar system?
Questions.Explanation: Nicolaus Copernicus published his book 'De Revolutionibus Orbium Coelestium' in 1543, presenting the heliocentric model.

Questions.Question: The first direct image of a black hole was captured by the Event Horizon Telescope. True or False?
Questions.Explanation: In 2019, the Event Horizon Telescope collaboration unveiled the first-ever image of the shadow of a supermassive black hole in the galaxy Messier 87.

Questions.Question: What type of galaxy is the Milky Way classified as?
Questions.Explanation: The Milky Way is a barred spiral galaxy, where a central bar-shaped structure extends outward from the core.

Questions.Question: Which mission discovered evidence of a subsurface ocean on Jupiter's moon Europa?
Questions.Explanation: The Galileo orbiter's observations and magnetic field measurements indicated the presence of a subsurface ocean on Europa in the 1990s.

Questions.Question: At what facility did the first detection of gravitational waves occur?
Questions.Explanation: The Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO), with detectors in the US, made history by detecting gravitational waves from merging black holes in 2015.
